info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 24 at 1:22PM PDT until March 28 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet possible along interstate 5 south of Weed to Dunsmuir and highway 89. Total storm accumulations of up to 3 feet in the Ski Bowl area. Total storm accumulations of 8 to 12 inches on highway 97 northeast of Weed and interstate 5 around and south of Weed. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph near Weed. * WHERE...Central Siskiyou County, South Central Siskiyou County and North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS....Snowfall rates could approach 1 inch per hour Monday night into Tuesday morning. Moderate to strong winds near and south of Weed in combination with heavy snow could result in near whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
